subject: Philosophy
title: The Golden Rule
description: A 60-second lesson on The Golden Rule.

hook.text: Treat others as you'd want to be treated. Nearly every civilization invented this rule.

buildup.text: Confucius, Jesus, Hillel, and the Buddha all taught versions of it independently.

discovery.text: It works because it forces empathy â€” you must imagine yourself in the other person's position.

twist.text: But it fails when preferences differ. A masochist following the Golden Rule would harm others.

climax.text: The Platinum Rule improves it: treat others as they want to be treated, not as you would.

punchline.text: Good rules sometimes need better rules.

quiz.question: What is a common criticism of the Golden Rule?
options: It assumes everyone has the same preferences
